Also in the room were ironing board & iron, TV, Hairdryer, coffee maker and fridge (not sure if every room had a fridge) but NO Safety deposit box. Within the hotel complex are a gym, swimming pool (which we didn't use as the weather was a bit cool!) and a small shop at the hotel. There is also a restaurant which we only used the restaurant once for breakfast on the first day of our stay. The breakfast was a choice of typical American buffet (cereals, pastries, toast) or ordering a cooked breakfast from the menu. As far as the food itself was concerned - the breakfast we ate was fine - nothing spectacular but nice all the same. Located in the same building as the restaurant was a coffee shop and internet point, although the internet was not free to use. The location of the hotel was very close to Universal Studios (about 5 min drive and about 10 min drive (depending on traffic) to Hollywood Blvd.) Also drove to Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and Venice Beach which were about 30- 40 min drive away depending on traffic (which can be very heavy on the freeways close to L.A. at times) I would warn you of a guy who stands outside reception (he works for the hotel) and tries to sell excursions. We managed to talk our way out of not buying anything but he can be a bit pushy in trying to sell Universal studios and sightseeing trips of L.A. so be prepared unless you want to book through him. Overall we booked our stay in this hotel to explore LA and we were not disappointed as the Holiday Inn Beverly Garland made for a great base to explore L.A by car.

Reviews.Title: “It's a well-run Holiday Inn in a great location”
Reviews.Author: shortysboyKansas
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of reviews about this place here on TA, I caution folks considering this place not to over-complicate the decision. Here's what it is; -GREAT beds- some of the most comfy I experienced- in my bed and the kids, too -Good food with really nice and enthusiastic service, granted it's February and it was rainy but this folks tried hard and did it with a smile, not an attached chain place. -Terrific, centralized location just 30 seconds off the freeway, -Quiet rooms (despite being only 30 seconds from the freeway- and we had a room facing the freeway, still quiet) with easy internet access and TV/games for the kids. -Well equipped exercise room with a very modern gear and plenty to go around. -Like the restaurant, this independent bar was cozy and relaxed. Drinks weren't skimpy but neither were their prices- probably fair by LA standards. $7 Jack Daniels & water Here's what it isn't: This is NOT a world-class, 5 diamond, "tell someone you want to impress about" kinda place but the price tag is in line with what they offer. If you like some genuine "nice" in a big city like LA, consider this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWoodlands
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Beverly Garland after an absence of a few years and were delighted with the upgrades to the property. As always, the staff were helpful, polite and well-trained. Our room had had a recent make-over and while the wonderful sound-proofing remained, one noted improvements to the bathroom, sleeping area, etc. as well as secure parking and building access. Comfortable, quiet, secure, convenient. Most of all, what we had always come to expect was still the case -- the Beverly Garland is an oasis at the cross-roads of Los Angeles. Just a few minutes from Universal City with easy access to freeways for Hollywood, the West Side, downtown, etc. We highly recommend it and look forward to returning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and disappointing?”
Reviews.Author: PrettyPerfect
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many hotels and numerous Holiday Inn hotels. Generally ok but this has to be the worst experience. At first glance this seemed ok. I stayed with family who booked a short break during the New Year period, using their Priority Club Rewards points. We had 2 interconnecting rooms; both with 2 double beds and the usual facilities. We even had free parking. Staff were ok; and actually the hotel is in an ok location. We missed the shuttle to Universal City and ended up going most places by car as it's conveniently located just off the highway. Downtown LA isn't far at all. On the first night we had a bad experience though. I was woken up gone 4am by the sound of a hotel door closing. At first thought it was another room in the coridoor then thought it was too loud and I checked the door to my own room. To my horror, I found that the door had been opened but the only thing stopping anyone coming through into the room was that the security latch was on - I could see that it had been pushed in. I phoned the reception straightaway as I had a child in the room and told them that someone had tried to access my room, thinking that perhaps they had issued someone a keycard for the same room in error. They rang back to say it was probably security doing their checks. Left it til the next morning to follow up but we were extremely unhappy and couldn't get back to sleep that night with worry. They sent someone up the next morning to check who had accessed the room by reading the card reader. It turns out it WAS security who had tried to check the room as 'routine' part of their checks during the night. The reception maintained this was legitimate normal practice and that the room had accidentally been checked out of their systems so it showed the room was empty. It can't be right that a member of staff walks around accessing rooms in the middle of the night. We had locked the door and put the security latch on, but imagine if we hadn't and someone had openly walked into our room during the middle of the night! We felt this was an unsatisfactory answer and escalated the complaint to the general manager. The receptionist we spoke to later was apologetic and offered us a complimentary dinner or breakfast which we tried to take up but when we did the assistant manager tried to rescind the offer of dinner. We settled for breakfast in the end but felt as though the hotel didn't take our complaint seriously. This did rather overshadow the rest of our stay I'm afraid and I will be weary of booking at a Holiday Inn anytime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “My home address in L.A.!”
Reviews.Author: Shahbanoe
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is absolutely the place for a long stay, escpailly for those like us who know how to find their way in the area, know the locals and rather have the comfort at home as well as a bit of luxuary, good care and friendly staff as well as a safe reliable and not too expensive parking place for the car and spacious rooms. The rooms are not too small and not too big, just the right size and big enough for the couples or families with children, especially those with childeren who easily can use the hotel Shuttle to Universal Studio's and City Walk in its close vicinity, a few blocks away there are gas stations, a pizza hut and a few strip malls that provide enough possibilities to buy your stuff. Hotel's pool is not too big, but cosy and you can easily relax when having not much to do or just tired. Hotel's staff is really really friendly and most of them recognise you if you stay there for a while and that makes your return even more pleasant. Decent luxuary, simplicity, friendliness and tranquility in the midst of a busy city and of a hotel so close to one of major highways. We like Beverly Garland hotel so much that we always get back and stay there for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “My regular hotel in LA ... I've tried others and I'm back at BGHI!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadtoomuch
Reviews.Content: I've been in LA on business every few months for the last three or four years. I stayed at this hotel early on because it was cheap and close to my operations in North Hollywood. I've tried other hotels in NH, Hollywood and Burbank, but I've ALWAYS come back to BGHI. First, I've NEVER had BETTER service from hotel staff anywhere I have stayed. These are the best bunch of people working in the industry today. Always helpful. Always friendly. Always willing to solve problems. Over the last couple of years, much has been done to upgrade the quality of the rooms and hotel grounds. Very clean and very comfortable. Sure, it's a Holiday Inn so the decor is a bit campy, but forget about it. (Though I don't understand the red covers on all of the books...) I wrote a review a couple of years ago warning people about the bar. It's completely changed. Granted, I could do without the music videos on all of the TVs, but otherwise it's great. There's only ONE reason that I don't give this place FIVE stars: dinner service. The restaurant is too bright -- not conducive to a quiet dinner -- and the dinner meals are mediocre at best. There are many other places to eat dinner in the area, so it's not a big deal. Breakfast and lunch menus are fine. I see others complaining about breakfast, but, for the price, it's a great deal. And lunch is lunch: sandwiches, salads, whatever. Not upscale, but decent. The value for the money is outstanding at BGHI. Finally, re: safety. I've walked all around the area and found it safe. Yea, it's a CITY so you have to be careful and alert, but it's not as frightening as some have implied.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place, Staff, and Food”
Reviews.Author: paulrutk
Reviews.Content: The Beverly Garden Holiday Inn is a Great Stay! We flew in for the Rose Parade and were scheduled to stay 6 nights. After being stuck in Newark's Airport for 2 days we only had 4 nights left. They not only held my reservations but only charged me the 4 nights that I stayed. The staff was exceptional and assisted us with directions to each attraction. They found out that it was our anniversary and sent a bottle of wine to our room. We ate at the hotel's restaurant several times during the stay. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the dinners were superb all at a very affordable price. The chef was amazing and the service was prompt. I would rate this hotel with 5 stars in all categories. Staff Friendliness, Staff Helpfulness, Restaurant, Pool, Gift shop and Room. The only thing that was disappointing was that the hot tub was broke while we were there. You must stay here if you are in the LA/Hollywood area! P.S. They have shuttle service to Citywalk/Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Universal Studios but that's all”
Reviews.Author: The_Original_Bobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Beverly Garlands Holiday Inn, it was easy to find as just off the freeway. It's really close to Universal Studios and they do lay on a shuttle bus to take you there, if you catch the time right that is as we found it sat on the car park most the time and it was quicker to walk, as this bus also drops at the metro station (or so we were told, we never actually caught it). Our room was of the bog-standard variety and did us for the 3 nights its a shame it's so far out of the way we had to catch the metro and buses everyday to do any sight seeing. But on the bright side the metro is very cheap and if your doing alot of travelling it's worth getting a day ticket. We did have breakfast one morning at the BG and the pancakes & maple syrup were great. Watch out for the guy standing outside the hotel who wants to sell you tours, he caught us the second we walked out of the hotel and before we knew it we where on a 4 hour tour of LA and $120 lighter. Rob who was our tour guide was great and there was only 2 other people on the trip so that was a bonus. There are lots of tour companies doing the same routes whether the cheaper ones are as good I just couldn't say.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect find!”
Reviews.Author: cazz81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn for five nights in the beginning of December at the start of a mini tour of the States. We stayed in this hotel to explore LA and can honestly say we were not dissapointed. I had emailed the hotel prior to our stay to advise that it was a surprise for my partner (this was his 40th birthday present!!) and when we checked in the receptionist wished Steve a happy birthday and advised that they had upgraded our room to a larger corner room with a fridge - fantastic!! We checked in to our room on the fifth floor and it was spacious and extremely clean. You can tell this isnt a brand new hotel but everything was in good working order and kept extremely clean and tidy. We had lots of storage space, a very comfy king size bed and a nice balcony overlooking the Hollywood hills and tennis courts. There was a function room below and we did experience some noise, but this finished reasonably early and I cannot say it bothered us. There are tennis courts, a gym, swimming pool and a small shop at the hotel. There is also a restaurant and bar, we only used the restaurant once for breakfast on the day we left. It was very nice but seemed very quiet in the evenings. Ironing board & Iron, TV (not flat screen), Hairdryer all in room. NO Safes. Parking was not a problem - charged $12 per night. Easily accessible to get to all the sights. Right off the interstate, so you could hear the traffic but nothing major. It was nice staying at this hotel, as you felt safe and it was in a nice residential area but close to all the attractions - would definately reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel tucked away in LA”
Reviews.Author: vacationguyOmaha
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, tucked away in the heart of Los Angeles near Universal Studios. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. My wife, daughter and I were only there one night of our trip, so we didn't intereact with the staff, except at check-in and out. Despite being right in the heart of Universal City, it was quiet with little to no traffic noise. Very close to Universal Studios and Hollywood/Beverly Hills. I understand that they have a shuttle that goes to Universal hourly, but since we had a car, there was no need to use it. If you want to take in the whole Hollywood experience, and have a car to drive...this is a great place to stay. I will probably do it again, since we go out to LA every fall for an end-of-season, prewinter getaway. Oh, and the price per night is very competitive. Sorry, I didn't shoot any hotel pics, but the website is very accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Holiday Inn I've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: myheartisinny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were pleased about our choice to stay at this hotel. It was clean, the room was spacious and comfortable and the staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel & Close to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: bubblejenuk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in Nov 08 and we found this hotel fairly average. It was clean and quiet with all the relevant amenities one would expect for a 3 star hotel. The hotel had a minibus to take their guests to Universal Studios every hour (which was v convenient and it only took only 5mins) and the Concierge was v helpful with giving directions and organising tours to downtown LA, the Chinese Theatre, Beverly Hills etc. Foodwise, the onsite restaurant is OK but a little bit pricey. For decent food head to CityWalk at the side of Universal Studios (although it's still pricey!). This hotel is not close to anything else except for Universal Studios & Warner Bros Studios. If you want to be downtown and nearer to the other attractions - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “average rooms”
Reviews.Author: janneman10
Reviews.Content: the welcoming of our stay was very friendly, the lady´s at the frontdesk are doing a great job, top ! the free shuttle-bus is nice also the parking place of the hotel is good. we had a good time in this hotel, we did not had breakfast, the restaurant looked very nice the rooms are average, perhaps i expected a much newer look, reading the hotel reviews before booking i liked it but next time a try another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SSO76
Reviews.Content: Found the staff most helpful nothing was a problem to them speak to the staff before you book any sight seeing trips the company they use is great. Free Bus to Universal Studios also free internet connection in all rooms. Hotel is also close to Underground where one stop takes you to the Chineas Theater and the walk of fame and many other attractions Rooms furnished to a high standard by far the best Hotel out of the four Hotels we stayed in this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations !”
Reviews.Author: opel
Reviews.Content: We (family of four) stayed in this property for two nights at the end of October 08. The Hotel is exactly what you would expect from an above average Holiday Inn,the Staff were friendly and efficient,the location is good and the shuttle to Universal is great,the problem with the drivers/consierge trying to sell additional trips is exaggerated in my opinion,we just politely said no thanks and there was no problem ? The restaurant attached didn't look great so we eat locally for breakfast( The Neighbourhood Cafe as recommended by TA reviewers and it was great),for Dinner we drove to Santa Monica (about 15/20 mins and there were lots of varied restaurants to choose from) All in all a very satisfactory stay !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: Maudvilla
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to LA, we weren't too sure which area to stay in and had heard some horror stories about staying in Hollywood. The Beverly Garland was recommended by a friend although the travel agent said they didnt recommend it without a car (which we did not have) - the hotel was great! Good location, couple of bars/shops within a 10 minute walk and the shuttle bus to universal was excellent. The metro was only a 15 minute walk and this took us into Hollywood - I would definately stay here again any questions, please email me [---]

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But With A Surprise Guest”
Reviews.Author: hoteltraveler1990
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel room was nice we enjoyed it but there's one thing that kind of freaked us out. I know there's no reported hauntings there or anything but in room 206 there was something like that going on. We were constantly hearing noises through the night coming from INSIDE OUR room. We didn't want to say anything not wanting to sound dumb, but after leaving my husband asked me if i heard anything at night and then we started comparing the things that we herd. We experienced things such as: faint knocking sounds on door and on table inside the room when no one was there or even awake, shuffling, items moving, window squeaking, and also shadows. This may sound strange, but that's what happened to us during our stay at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn. It's not a big deal or anything just thought we'd give future guests to room 206 a heads up. If you had any experiences like this at the hotel, please email your story to aricbell@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and well located”
Reviews.Author: careless01
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and included free high speed internet. The hotel is well located with a free shuttle to Universal Studios, and short drives to Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Walk of Fame, about 1/2 hour from LAX and a quick drive to Warner Brothers Studio. The beds were comfortable, our room was quiet, although a bit small for four adults.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for seeing all the Hollywood / LA sights”
Reviews.Author: janeypiejesus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute as we wanted a pretty central hotel to see the sights of LA and Hollywood. Check in was quick and simple. Room was comfortable and clean, had everything we needed. The hotel had a smallish pool and people seemed to use it throughout the day (what a waste of potential LA sight seeing time though!!!. There was a decent cafe / restaurant type place which was good for breakfast. the hotel provided a free shuttle bus to Universal Studios which was handy too. The location was great for us as we had a car but then i don't think anyone goes to LA without their own transport do they! We found this hotel very convenient and much more reasonable than staying in other hotels in similar locations.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant....Loved It”
Reviews.Author: ChicoHernadez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Garland on the second destination of our tour and it was brilliant. set just outside of universal city, the hotel takes you up to universal studios free where you can catch the metro to pretty much everywhere. You can even walk to the metro as it is only a few minutes away. the room itself was good, decent sized, great view of the hollywood hills and free wireless internet. the hotel breakfast was not so great though. overall, enjoyed the stay and would recommend to any young travellers on a budget... it doesnt get better then this.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: rasol
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Beverly Garland's Holliday inn. We are a 5 person family from Norway, and had to have 2 rooms. We got connecting rooms, which we were very happy with. We were all together, and we had lots of space at the same time. We enjoyed the comfort of two bathrooms 2 TV's as which was fine, since the oldest and the younger children had different interests. We were very happy with: The rooms, the service of the staff, the possibility to bath in the pool, and the possibility to wash our clothes in the valet laundry. We also have to mension the fabulous service we got from Sonia at the Tula's Cafe. The breakfast was always. Our daughter Karianne was became very fond of her. All in all we don't have anything negtive to say about our stay. The only thing that keeps us from top score is that we never got any resonse to the e-mails we sent to the Hotel with a few questions before we arrived. If we get a chance, we will be back. All our regards to the Hotel, and to So Sonia in the Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, good time!”
Reviews.Author: deltamikelima
Reviews.Content: From check-in, every employee we spoke to was pleasant and courteous. We ate in the on site Tula's restaurant on our first night. Menu was typical though plentiful and good quality. Service was very efficient too. Didn't try the bar area. Ate at Tula's for two breakfasts too. Again typical menu and albeit a buffet offered, we stuck to the menu as the buffet was simple. We stayed in one of the family rooms with one king and a bunk bed for our two children. Room was large and comfortable and more than adequate. Included was a mircowave that we did not use, non-stocked (but working fridge) plus LCD TV. The on-site pool looked great, though we did not use. Open from 08.00am to 10.00pm. Towels were available and always on the beds in the morning. Seemed the pool was *not* popular as there was always free beds. So if you were looking for a relaxing day by the pool, there's no need to awake at stupid o'clock to resreve a bed! Fantastic location, about 5 minutes drive from Universal City. There's a free shuttle to and from Universal every hour. We did not take this service as we wanted to use the hire car and be in control of our own timings. This was a professionally run accommodation and everyone was pleasant and happy to help. Would I recommend, yes!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Baggiechris
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel very close to Universal Studios (5 min in car) and close to freeway and Hollywood Small pool but good to cool off in Restaurant good but not great. Overall good place to stay if you want to stay in this area of LA

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: kd60
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 night stay at this hotel. It is in need of some cosmetic work, but the rooms are adequate. The beds are comfortable and the balconies are a nice feature. The front desk and gift shop personnel are very nice. The men who run the shuttle spend far too much time trying to sell tours. The hotel offers a shuttle to Universal and/or the metro. This sounds great, but is very limited. It does not run for about 3 hours during the day and the last shuttle pick up is 9:15pm even though the park is open until 9 and city walk is open until at least midnight. DO NOT EAT At TULA's, the hotel's only dining option. I can honestly say, I have never had food as bad as this place. After a day of flying from Mass to Calif, we went in for a quick bite. First, nothing happens quickly here. I watched 2 different parties leave after not being acknowledged. I ordered a hambuger, my son a reuben, and young son ordered a kids chicken meal. There is no way my hamburger was cooked that day!! It was old. Chicken meal was almost black, and reuben was on stale bread! You will need a car or cab to eat anywhere around this hotel, unless you eat all your meals at Citywalk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in its simplicity, excellent frontdesk”
Reviews.Author: DutchTravelagent
Reviews.Content: Arrived on July 11th and spent two nights. The man at the frontdesk was very helpful and interested in our travel plans. We asked for a ground floor room and he offered us one with the least traffic noise, although the hotel was fully booked. Every question we had about Los Angeles, how to get here and there, was answered calmly and professionally . The recepion has a drawer with little pieces op paper with the FAQ of their guests; impressive, bever seen anything like it. The room was OK, not too big, not small either. A little balcony overlooking the parking, so little dragging with the suitcases. The shuttle for Universal Studios was very OK, regular timings, so no need to take a hotel close to Universal which are in the middle of nowhere except of course the theme park itself. For future visitors who don't want to spend a lot of money on breakfast: leave the hotel and turn left; just before the traffic lights, turn left again and you will see a large Ralphs supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonBangor_UK
Reviews.Content: Originally booked two nights from our main stay in Las Vegas to go to Universal Studios and explore the city but ended up adding a third as we liked it so much. The staff went out of their way to do this as it was already fully booked (thanks to the girl working on reception AM 23/08/08) and kept our same room. Rooms are big and clean and the resturant food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great family rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gomersal-08
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with our room, a King Kids Deluxe. It had lots of space. There was a sofa bed, king bed, bunk beds, with the bottom bunk a double size, plus a table and four chairs. Great for a family on a trip. There's also a great gym, small pool which does pool-side drinks and food service. The shuttle buss runs hourly too and from Universal and is very prompt. The only down side is that on top of the not cheap room rate, they then charge you per day for parking - it would feel so much better if they didn't try and make extra money this way. However, we would stay again just for the room size and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad As Everyone Thinks”
Reviews.Author: BedroomDivaParties
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn starting on July 13th-16th 2008. I took the time and read the reviews regarding the hotel and took everything in. Some people stated on the reviews that the food was horrible and that the area wasn't safe. Here is an honest review that I hope helps everyone from a frequent hotel traveler. The hotel is outdated and is in need of a few face lifts including new carpeting in the hallways. The hallways could also use a bit more lighting but it isn't scary. The room was clean and came with a coffee maker, hairdryer, tons of towels (we had 4 adults in our room) and an iroining board etc. Our room was kept clean and we never had a problem. We stayed in the Eldorado building which if sitting outside on the small balcony (large enough for two people to sit) the sound of the freeway is noticeable. BUT, once you are inside the room with the airconditioning on, you can't even hear it. Our group didn't have any problem sleeping. When we arrived we were asked about taking tours and we simply said that we were there for business so we didn't have time-we weren't asked again and I never felt pressured or pushed to attend a tour. We took advantage of the coffee shop and I experienced an "okay" chai latte, but not a big deal. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning which costs $11.95. I personally felt that this was a bit steep considering what was offered and felt that if it was around $7.95 that would be better-but the food was good. The eggs were egg beaters but it wasn't terrible. The area surrounding the hotel is safe. We attended an event about three blocks up and was able to walk back to the hotel at 11:00pm without an issue. The only issue that I had was that we had to pay for parking. Now, I was only charged $11.00 a day vs the $13.00 I am hearing but I still think that this is ridiculous since I was staying at their hotel and already giving them money via the hotel room. This wouldn't make me not stay there again, but I would look for a place that maybe didn't charge as much. The location is not far from Universal Studios and there is a shuttle that is offered by the hotel to get you there. The shuttle does not pick up at the airport-please keep that in mind when making plans. I hope this helps..

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RobynW
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out stay at the Beverly Garland. Location: The location of the Beverly Garland is good–just off the freeway with easy access to Disney (took us about an hour but the traffic is crazy). There are a number of Hollywood/LA tours you can book right at the hotel. The bus stops at the hotel to pick you up and you really don’t have to travel far. The shuttle to Universal is great BUT when you’re returning home at night remember that a ton of other guests will be returning as well and there may not be room for you (which means you wait for the next shuttle). FYI: spend the extra $$$ and take the VIP Tour at Universal. Great value for money and if you don’t book it you will probably spend your day hating those (and yourself) with the VIP cards who go right past you in line and who get to get off their trams and explore the sets while you sit on your tram and simply drive by. While at the Beverly we spent a day at Universal, a day touring Hollywood and a day at Santa Monica Beach (not a bad drive at all considering it is LA). Rooms: No fridge but otherwise fine. Nice, simple accommodation. You probably don’t want a room on the ground floor since these rooms are actually ‘downstairs’ and really only have a view of the hill they’re built into. We started out on the second floor and had sewage back up in the tub (gross, but they moved us immediately, no problem) and ended up on the first floor right near the pool. Very convenient. There is laundry in one of the buildings. Pool: Small but nice. Always loads of loungers. Snack bar and towels. There’s a hot tub and sauna too but we didn’t use these. Food: I liked Tula’s. The menu had loads of variety and the prices were reasonable. Concerns: My concerns are not so much about the hotel but have more to do with the fact that I booked this hotel because of its review in Frommer’s. Frommer’s stated that kids under 12 eat free. That didn’t happen for us and I’m not sure why–I was just told that we didn’t have that package. Maybe Frommer’s should indicate you have to buy a special package to get this. Also, Frommer’s indicated Free Parking. That also did not happen–we paid $13 a day I believe. Minor things, I know, but these were two reasons I booked here so I was annoyed. This is a very pleasant family hotel and a good location from which to sightsee. There’s really not much around the hotel itself (very residential) but I would recommend it as a base from which to do Universal and see LA.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by the beg bug”
Reviews.Author: starzs
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to universal studios,it was the cheapest in the area and it provided free shuttle service to universal studios. The staff was nice and friendly. No problem with the sevice at all. The food was good little pricey but okay. The rooms appeared to be clean. The first morning I got up went to my aunt's room . She and her granddaughter were still in bed. I noticed a red stain on the sheet of the bed the 9 year old was sleeping in. I approached the bed and then observed little bugs. I smashed the bug with a piece of paper and it stained the sheet, looked like a blood stain. Would you know it BED BUGS. We called immediately to the front desk, we were told the manager was not on site. They sent up the engineer he checked behind the headboard with a flashlight. An hour later someone else came to the room and he tried to tell us that these bugs came in sliding door because it was open and that they were not bed bugs. Not knowing that we had caught them in a plastic bag and showed him the evidence that these were in fact BED BUGS. He finally agreed to not charge us for that night. Moved them to another room. After that our stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: joemess
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through AA Vacations with tickets to Universal (buy the Front of Line Pass - definitely worth the extra money). The main reason we chose it was location and then price. We really didn't have any expectations about the place and I'm not sure how others feel, but I don't rate Holiday Inn as a super hotel. We were arriving from another hotel stay in the area (see my other reviews) and arrived around noon. They seemed to be busy and we checked with the Front Desk to see if a room was available - the clerk that happened to serve us was clearly frustrated and overwhelmed and unfortunately a bit curt to us. He found a room, but advised it was on the first floor - what we didn't know was that we enter on the 2nd floor and take the elevator down. Our room was ground level and faced the parking lot - my companion was totally uncomfortable with this and we went back to see if a room on a higher floor was available. A different clerk helped us and found a room much more suitable (which surprised the other clerk). Rooms are like most HI hotels - average size, average amenities, but with coffee maker - no micro or fridge. "Balcony" was tiny, but usable. Things were clean and mostly comfortable. Restaurant was decent - we had buffet breakfast, and no awards would be given, but it was edible. Dinner was a surprise in that the food was interesting and good. Prices were reasonable as well. (I saw another review that panned the food, so I'm unsure if things changed since then). Location to Universal Studios was excellent for the price. Hotel offered shuttle service, but only on the hour for most hours and it would get you there an hour after opening (except on weekends). you can, however walk a few blocks to Universal Drive and from there you can either hike up a small hill to the entrance gate, or wait for the complementary USH shuttle. We never used the hotel shuttle, but it was nice to know they had it. As for the area, very residential Studio City. Two blocks away was a shopping center and some other restaurants, but nothing really worthwhile. Better to go to US City Walk. Overall, average stay but we were pretty much expecting it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and one stop from Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Henrik_Larsson_7
Reviews.Content: Myself and three of my friends stayed at this Hotel as part of a miniature Californian tour. It was clean, the staff were friendly and I did not notice any noise from the motorway. The reason I chose this Hotel was its relatively close proximity to Hollywood. There is a five minute walk to the subway/rail station and then one stop and you walk out right at the Chinese theatre, this was perfect for us as we went out clubbing at the Tropicana and the Roosevelt Hotel. Overall this Hotel provides clean accomodation and serves perfectly as a base for those who wish to go out drinking in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: sbury555
Reviews.Content: Not that impressed but the price was low so I cant complain too much. The food was absoulely terrible. we tried both breakfast and dinner and both were disgusting! the hotel also had a funky smell and the rooms were not spacious. also, the neighborhood was not the best although they do offer a free shuttle to universal studies. their website pictures seem a bit decieving. it wasnt a terrible stay but just not what i expected.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean quiet for a relasing break”
Reviews.Author: 1trainer1
Reviews.Content: This hotel I picked was based on reviews I had read from this website, I was pleasnalty suprised at how quiet the hotel was and when I did arrive I was dealt with promptly, the hotel reception was nice and helpful but the concierge/ baggage handlers were a bit unhelpful and alwas trying to sell us tours, when a tour came to pickup a few people from the hotel I overheard the concierge asking for his cut (not nice to see or hear) and on the final day when we were going to the airport because we booked out own transfer they didnt tell me when they arrived and didnt open the doors or help with our luggage or anything like that. good point was its location to universal studios and the free shuttle that it took us to daily if we wanted it

Reviews.Title: “what a noise”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldTopjoiner
Reviews.Content: very noisey hotel at side of freeway.asked to be moved no response from the management found them rude.toilet in room didnt work right had it fixed 3 times.very isolated position dont stop here

Reviews.Title: “This place can write the book on service”
Reviews.Author: Neil D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 7 days at the start & end of a Southern California / Nevada Holiday. The check in was fast & efficient. The room was huge & though located at the back overlooking the Hollywood Freeway was very quiet thanks to the double glazing. Wi-fi access in our room was excellent. Free shuttle bus service to the nearby Metro station & Universal Studios is great, as was the discounted tickets for Universal Studios in the gift shop. I can't say enough good things about this Hotel, We booked through a company called Purely America & found the price very reasonable. Big thanks to Richie & all the front desk staff for helping us enjoy a fantastic holiday

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Emma853536
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in March 2008. This hotel was a wonderful surprise. The staff are very helpful, the concierge was brilliant and helped us get to Disneyland and also a private tour of LA all for very reasonable prices. The rooms were large and comfortable, we had a balcony which was a hidden extra. I couldnt rave enough about this hotel, i would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: KingLeonidas
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn was good for the two days I was there on a two day business trip. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Areas of construction were not an issue. The catering at our seminar was provided by the Holiday Inn and was good. The beds were very nice and I had a great night sleep. It was close proximity to local area attractions. Overall I was pleased with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: longfella
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice and had a nice stay on both occasions. To start with the down sides, its right next to the busy 101 freeway although the traffic noise doesn't bother me. The parking is not cheap at $13 currently, but is secure nonetheless. I also found that the on site restaurant was quite expensive considering that the hotel offers no complimentary breakfast. If you don't like what is on offer it is a fair walk to get something elsewhere. There is a shopping area including a Ralph's store about 15 mins walk form the hotel. The hotel is very easy to get to from the freeway, it is virtually just off the Vineland Ave ramp. Contrary to some other reviews I found the area surrounding the hotel to be quite a nice neighbourhood and would have no problem walking around day or night. The hotel is large and in separate sections. The decor is quite old fashioned but I quite like that. The lobby is quite small and in an L shape. There are pictures on the wall from the old days. The staff are well dressed and courteous. The outside spaces & gardens are well kept. The are tennis courts but I did not use these. There are big pine trees which rise close to the buildings, you can touch them from the balcony. Maybe they are meant to block out traffic noise, not sure if they do but they look nice anyhow. The rooms are pretty average. on both occasions I have found the rooms & bathrooms to be clean & tidy. I don't remember there being a coffee maker in the room, but everything else you would expect. I didn't have any problems with rowdy guests. When I have stayed here most guests have been middle aged upward so I guess people in this age group tend to behave themselves. There is also a complimentary shuttle to Universal Studios which I used on both trips too. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: JSpera
Reviews.Content: Was a bit skeptical about staying at a Holiday Inn but I have to say we were very surprised. Hotel was very clean, rooms seem new and updated and very spacious. Hotel Staff was very helpful. Has a good restaraunt on site and is convenient to Universal and Hollywood attractions. Beds are very comfortable. Pool is small but nice and very well kept. Would definitely go back again. Great for families, a great bargain considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Heres the facts from our trip...”
Reviews.Author: l0ve4jesus
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed at the Beverly Garland for 4 nights. Here's my thoughts... Location- Near freeway, but we were not bothered by the traffic noise at all. Extremely close to Universal Studios- Great complimentary hotel shuttle to the studios. North Hollywood is a beautifully clean area, that is a lot safer than other parts of LA. Service- Very professional. Everything was slick and polished! Friendly front desk and doormen. Amenities- We did not end up trying the pool, sauna or tennis courts, but they looked good! There is also a gift shop on site which comes in handy. Tourist info- You can book tours and get area info from the gift shop on site. Food- The hotel has a on site restaurant/cafe which has excellent food and very friendly and eager to please staff. They are very good with handling children too... There was also a splash bar on the property. A 5-10minute walk down the road to supermarket and some takeaway shops. Room- Regular size. Nice beds. Good maid service. Advice- If you're planning on playing on the tennis courts you must be wearing proper tennis shoes, otherwise you will not be allowed on. The laundry room is a bit hard to find, so ask for specific directions. Most tour companies will pick you up from this hotel. The front desk is always busy, so try using their quick check out. A lot of functions and meetings happen at this hotel, so be careful that you don't accidentally walk into one! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: coolmom1990
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn while vacationing in the Los Angeles area. We visited Universal Studios, Hollywood, and Burbank, and found the hotel to be centrally located. The highlight of my experience of this hotel was the comfortable bed. Although I chose not to take advantage of it, the hotel offered a "pillow menu" giving us the opportunity to change the type of pillows we had depending on whether we slept on our back, side, etc. The staff was extremely friendly right down the the security guard. The room was a little small, but clean. The grounds were clean, and there were a lot of trees around the hotel. The only real disadvantage I could find to our room was the level of freeway traffic noise. The hotel is located right next to a major freeway, and I had a little difficulty getting to sleep the first night we stayed. I purchased ear plugs for our second night, but didn't end up using them because I fell asleep pretty quickly after sinking into our comfy bed. We ate at Tulas on our second evening. The food was pretty good, but a little overpriced for what we got. Overall, I considered our stay at this hotel a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, we'll stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Christine_Roger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed staying at this excellent hotel and will definitely stay there again whenever we are in Los Angeles. The room was excellent and the staff were pleasant and helpful. The facilities including restaurant, bar, grounds and laundry were excellent. We were impressed by the number of people we saw who were maintaining the hotel and grounds to a very high standard. Above average for a Holiday Inn and a hotel with character.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: jolady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located to Universal which is why we chose it. We actually walked from the park one day back to the hotel. They do provide a free shuttle though. The hotel is very dated is needing updating badly. It was only so-so in the cleanliness area. It wasn't great, and it wasn't terrible. Very overpriced though.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: ducati100ds
Reviews.Content: Great location for Universal, easy to find, reasonable price for Kids Suites which - as they say on their website - are actually standard twin queen rooms with one of the beds replaced with screened of twin bunk area. Worked well and cheaper than 'proper' suites. Free wi-fi but charge for parking. Great breakfasts at reasonable prices. Pool was warm even if the weather wasn't - nice little sauna. Excellent tennis courts. Second time we have been - very happy and we'll go again.

Reviews.Title: “Universal Studios Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: doctorderek
Reviews.Content: A very convenient,easy to find and,well appointed and reasonably priced hotel for a Los Angeles/ Universal Studio visit. If arriving by car as we did it is just off Hwy 101. There is a "Vineland Avenue" exit so it is difficult to miss. They have free shuttle bus to the studios. beverlygarland.com/

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, well maintained, good deal”
Reviews.Author: pilotbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. Nice clean rooms that look like thay have recently been renovated. Complementary Hotel shuttle to Universal. Daily Newspaper.Only downpoint is the highway behind the hotel. When booking make sure that you get a room in the Eldorado building pointing to the front. Parking fee is $11.-

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kelbelle
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying at this hotel as I had read reviews after finding out where my hotel had been booked (won a trip to see The Police in concert so all choices were made for me). The hotel is a bit older, but it's a good, average hotel. The on-site restaurant had wonderful food even though it was fairly quiet there. The on-site bar was also fun (we'd been drinking and didn't know where to catch a cab to go to so just stayed there). The employees at both the restaurant and club were very friendly and helpful. If I had o go to that area again, I would definitely keep this hotel in mind. My only complaint, paying for parking which isn't noted on the website anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great position for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Concord Pit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverley Garland for 4 nights, to see Hollywood and Universal Studios. The hotel has a cool almost woodland setting, yet is very close to the freeway (but no traffic noise!) Our room was pretty high up overlooking the childrens playground, which looked excellent for the kids! The pool area was larger than we expected. The restaurant, whilst in the style of a diner served excellent food. Our room was spacious, and airy with good A/C. The hotel is 5 min drive from Universal Studios, but when getting back, be careful that other guests who have been waiting shorter than you dont push to the front of the queue for the courtesy bus. Reception staff were excellent, but lack of a concierge was disappointing, but all staff were very helpful. If you wan to tour hollywood on the red buses, you can catch one at Universal studios, but note that the bus has no logo or livery and is a plain red single deck bus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, $11 a day to park”
Reviews.Author: sushidan141
Reviews.Content: Booked this room on Priceline for $90 a night. The hotel is next to the 101 freeway and a 5 minute drive, or shuttle bus ride to Universal. The rooms are in two different towers which seem to be serviced by two elevators, one at each end. Elevators were busy at times. Rooms were clean and each had a small balcony. We had no complaints about this hotel except for the $11 a day parking fee. The Universal Studios shuttle only holds about 25 people, and for a hotel with hundreds of hotel rooms, our shuttle driver had to make several trips to pick up and drop off guests.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer909
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The room was smaller than expected, and it had a smell. Not sure what kind of smell, maybe because it was closed and had the air on, but we got used to it. The bed was a little soft. For the price, this was a decent hotel that was close to everything. I am a priority member, but did not get a welcome gift. I didn't know that I should get a gift. The shuttle to Universal was convenient, however, I wished that after 4 pm, it would run every hour. We had lunch at Tula's and found it to be very good. For the price, it was a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, staff, location, facility.”
Reviews.Author: MKaydee
Reviews.Content: First time on property. Stayed 5 nights for seminar at a gargantuan hotel a mile away. Am SOooo glad chose to stay here because it had much more of a small European hotel/country inn feel, e.g., staff friendliness and guest recognition, personable breakfast and dinner service in restaurant as well as room service, responsive and friendly housekeeping staff. Actually, ALL the staff were extremely friendly AND professional! Tula's restaurant onsite has excellent food and value. I had a breakfast and lunches at Hilton and Sheraton during mtgs and there is no comparison to Tula's yummy factor, service, portion and price. For dinner one night took waiters suggestion of chefs special (duck) and recommended wine pairing--great meal and evening. Re location: it's a pleasant 10 minute WALK to supermarket, chinese restaurant, starbucks and I felt very safe. I went for a dessert and coffee walk after late meeting at 1030pm and it's indeed an okay neighborhood to walk. Stayed 3 more nights a week later in August in a different wing and here's my take on the rooms, both times on the 5th (nonsmoking) floor: 1. Bldg on the far left behind lobby is where I stayed for first 5 nights. Bathtup didn't work for baths so had to shower but all else was great--room size, comfy king bed and pillow choices, quiet location (facing garden/lobby). Probably due for remodel/update in future. 2. August stay I was 2 bldgs behind the swimming pool/sauna area overlooking parking lot. Think it might be much more quieter and private than first bldg. This room was larger and nicely upgraded and seemed more like rooms I get when on corporate business account. Example of staff service, efficiency and personableness: I was stranded waiting for a cab company that kept saying "it'll be 15 minutes" and an hour and 4 phone calls later I was still waiting in the sweltering afternoon heat. At my wits end I called the hotel and Robin at the front desk expertly handled panicked guest (me), figured out where I was, called the cab company they usually use, had me wait in a specific area and a cab arrived 10 minutes later. During the 10 minute wait she called bacl to make sure I was where instructed to be and asked that I please let the front desk know when I got in so they knew I was okay and back at property. Recommend? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Friendly, Responsive Staff”
Reviews.Author: CATHYPConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Garland for five nights in Aug, 2007. Even though they had made a mistake by giving our room to someone else which we discovered on arrival and check in, they immediately took care of it, gave us free parking and were very apologetic. The hotel is lovely, clean and quiet with a great restaurant attached. In fact the best food for the money we had in LA. The pool is very nice, large, well maintained and clean. I felt safe and away from the LA madness while we were there. The rooms are adequate and typical Holiday Inn fare but clean and functional. It is close to the 101 which takes you everywhere you want to go and five minutes from Universal Studios. They have a free shuttle to Universal which runs throughout the day. So glad we found this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel far exceeded my expectation”
Reviews.Author: moe55
Reviews.Content: This was such a beautifuil hotel. The location is in a very safe, pretty area, so close to Universal Studios! The rooms weren't huge, but they were more than comfortable, and very clean. All of the staff was very friendly, everytime I passed someone in the hallway, they would smile and greet me. The pool felt like a mini paradise. It was beautiful, and the water temp was perfect. I only spent about 30 min. a day down there, but it was just the relxation I needed. Many different bus tours stop at the Beverly Garland, so if you are looking for a tour, you don't have to worry about finding a place to go, you just stand on the curb and the bus picks you up. Even the little restaurant had great food, service was a little slow, but that only gave us more time to enjoy the out door patio that was beautiful! I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: vindemure
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn and we wish we could have had more time. Very convienent location for Universal Studios. Our luggage was lost and the staff at the Beverly Garland fixed us (4 of us !) a goodie bag. This was not their responsibility but they did this without us asking. They contacted us as soon as our luggage arrived, late in the night. The airline (US Air) could have cared less. Super spot and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/performance”
Reviews.Author: Neierke
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean hotel with friendly employees. Good restaurant for your breakfast and dinner. Double rooms rather small but good for short stays. Five minutes by car to Universal Studios !!!!! Some rooms are rather noisy because it's located near the 110.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, convenient, clean”
Reviews.Author: imso808
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this Holiday Inn. Very clean & spacious rooms, helpful staff. It is very near to Universal Studios (not walking distance but near enough) and other Hollywood attractions. Pool was small but clean. Restaurant was great. Nothing fancy, just clean, safe accomodations for you & your family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Third time around”
Reviews.Author: foxyteacher
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to this property, and have truly enjoyed each and everyone. Yes, the rooms could certaintly use an update, however, the service makes up for it. EVERYONE... from the front desk ( Monika, Chris,etc. ) to the bartender, Shannon, was wonderful. Margo in the giftshop was especially helpful. She was such a joy while we were at the pool, attending to our every need. Please have dinner at their restaurant, Tula's. The Yankee Pot Roast is the best I've ever tasted, and I'm really picky! I am always surprised at how many locals patronize this property for the restaurant & bar. That says a lot!!! Will I stay here again? You bet! By the way, the El Dorado bldg. overlooks the courtyard & pool if you request rooms 505-510. 508 is the best!!! Go & have fun, the FREE Universal shuttle is awesome, whether you're going into the park or just having fun on the CityWalk.

Reviews.Title: “most attentive service”
Reviews.Author: DOCMumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 days and was most happy with the attentive service from the desk to the bell desk (Freddie et al). I forgot some clothes in the hotel and the staff esp Barbara, Roseanne and Kyle? who helped me trace it and Fedex it to my next and the NEXT hotel as we travelling the west coast, She even went out of the way to promise me that incase we dont receive it on my last day they would mail it to my residence in Mumbai India. Kudos to the entire team

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a night or two in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: weets
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in April 2007 prior to flying back to the UK. Chose it mainly for proximity to Universal. This hotel is absolutely fine for a night or 2. It is dated and in need of some money spending on it but it is clean and tidy. Good level of in room amenities and security is good. On site coffeee shop and small store. The hotel runs a free shuttle to Universal and there are set times to and back. But, we found that you could ask for a special trip or additional trip and the guys were happy to oblige - fantastic service (a cab is $6 each way). As we only stayed for a night did not venture out and about. Drive to LAX is 60 minutes at 4pm and is easy - the Holiday Inn website will let you find and print directions). Car park at hotel $11 a day. Overall, it's not the best hotel I haver ever stayed in but it serves a purpose and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: zggb0b
Reviews.Content: I wasn't quite sure what to expect at the Beverly Garland, but it was definitely better than I thought it would be after reading some of the reviews posted here. The overall impression that greeted me on arriving was that it was quite dated. The Reception Staff were very helpful, and the staff in the Gift/Tour shop were extremely friendly and helpful. The room, on first impressions, was pretty cramped, but adequate, clean, and comfortable. We were put in the annex building which overlooked the freeway. The noise wasn't a problem, unless you left the balcony door open. The complimentry Wi-Fi connection for my laptop was excellent. We had a toilet blockage, but the Maintenance man was there within 10 minutes to fix it (this was at 10 PM). The restaurant at the front (Tula's) served some excellent food, and had an outdoor area where you could eat / drink when the weather was nice..which we did. You could also order room service from here. You would definitely need a car if you wanted to go shopping, as the nearest Mall was about 10 mins away by car and the hotel is a bit isolated, unless you are planning to go to Universal (the hotel runs a regular free shuttle throughout the day). We were only here for two nights as a stopover travelling from Australia, New Zealand and Fiji, and we did a tour to Tijuana on one day (which is another story), so did not feel the need to hire a car. Overall, it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy! Not the place to stay if you want to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: SN2BPHD
Reviews.Content: The rooms were well kept. They are actually what a Holiday Inn should look like. Unfortunately, the ajoining door between rooms was the source of major niose. The next door neighbors were watching TV all night. I wouldn't have made much of it, but with thin walls and with an ajoining door, we could hear everything. The TV was on all last night there. I even tried to put a towel under the door. It didn't work. I was up until 5am. The housekeeping service also knocks on the door at 9:30am. When you get less than 5 hours of sleep, housekeeping are the last people you want to see. Also my key cards did not work the second night. When I went to the desk, they were 'fixed" but when I tried again, only one worked. The staff was not overly friendly. I had to ask for my rewards perks, even though it should say so in the computer. The plus of the stay was the lady in the gift shop. She knew all about the tours and which would best suite us. She even wanted to save us money. Be prepaired to pay for parking. With AAA=$9, without =$11.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: karlio2020
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our multi-centre trip booked with United Vacations and found this to be a most exceptional. The hotel was clean, comfortable and the service was excellent. Checking in was very quick and very easy, parking was also easy and there were plenty of spaces. The concierge was most helpful and made dinner reservations for us on the Queen Mary. The room was spacious and the bathroom was clean, and well maintained. The food in Cafe Tula was excellent as was the service and competitively priced. The hotel itself was located in a very good location, close to local amenities and Studio City, minutes to universal. We did notice that the hotel was near the 'free way' as it has been previously mentioned in other reviews that it was noisey, however, we did not find it to be noisey enough to disturb our sleep, infact it was barely audible. Lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Wiz147
Reviews.Content: I read reviews about this hotel just before leaving the uk and was overall impressed and then read one about the maid service being every 3 days and head lice!! what a load of rubbish that is, we stayed here for 2 weeks and the hotel room and grounds are spotless, the maids come in every single day with fresh clean towels and linen, they also hoover up and top up your free coffee etc etc if you have made any brews. unlike some of my experiences in spain, the maids also will not come into your room if u have put the 'do no disturb' sign outside your door, i had an off day during our holiday and was glad to see they adhere to your requests and dont still insist on coming in. also someone said there is not much around the hotel area, erm?? universal studios and city walk is only 7 min walk away to the tram that takes u up the hill. the red line metro station is also on route to universal, just go left out the hotel left onto ventura and left again across the freeway flyover. u will also pass a shopping complex on vineland just before ventura blvd which has everthing u need including a kodak shop incase u run out of camera batteries etc. the onsite gift shop prices are very respectable and the lady who works there during the day is superb at helping u if u want to book tours or airport pick ups. if u dont fancy the short walk to the metro and universal the 156 metro bus goes to hollywood/highland, which u can get from across the street from the hotel carpark entrance. resturant breakfast is excellent, with the only downside being that the buffet unlike other hotels is not free and u have to pay 11.95 per person for it before tipping etc. also they have 2 internet computers in the splash lounge which u just put 1 or 5 dollar bills in to gain your desired time u need for surfing.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK!”
Reviews.Author: TW3
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems a little dated at first impression - but our room was just fine. The king bed was very comfortable and so were the towels. We stayed two nights. Our basic complaint is the hidden charge for parking ($11/night) that you are informed of at check-in. The restaurant is very nice. Good food, decently priced. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Big rooms”
Reviews.Author: ozziecouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on arrival in LA. Very big room and friendly front desk staff. Safe area and about three blocks walk to Metro stop. Free shuttle to Universal studios and excellent buffet breakfast and restaurant. Also has internet access in cafe also. A short cab or one train stop to Hollywood Boulevard. We were suprised how quiet our room was considering it was next to the freeway. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hated the head lice”
Reviews.Author: aussie333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on its proximity to Universal studios and it was cheaper than the Sheraton or Hilton. I was disappointed with the facilities, the hotel definitely needs a refurbishment, but it did appeared to be clean. Unfortunate I got head lice from stay. Notices in the room state that the linen is changed every 3 days unless you request it daily. I guess the cleaning staff must be enforcing this rule even if new guests are using the room. Definitely spoilt what should have been an enjoyable trip to the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, really nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: erodriguez215
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms through priceline.com for a friday night $100. We stayed just to sleep for the night, the king size bed was very comfortable, the rooms and property overall are well maintained, older look but well maintained. Two exits from Universal Studios City Walk. We didnt use the pool but it looked very small for the size of the property. The best part of our stay was breakfast. The food was piping hot and especially loved that it was not greasy. We had eggs, home potatoes, bacon, toast, french toast, fresh fruit, freshly squeezed orange juice, pancakes and omellettes. Good breakfast spot, they even served Seattles best coffee if you asked for it. Otherwise you got folgers. I would definitely stay here again for a short visit. I may even drive by and have breakfast if im in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: cf_bib
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay if you're planning on seeing Universal Studios. A good value hotel. Breakfast and hotel bar are both good. Also has a decent pool.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MISSTRIPPY
Reviews.Content: hotel brilliant all facilities u could need. only criticism is shuttle bus provided by hotel finishes too early at night but thetre are buses and taxis on the road outside

Reviews.Title: “so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: jubileejan
Reviews.Content: stayed there in oct 06 with husband and 21 year old daughter. reception staff not overly friendly but polite. waitresses,shuttle bus and gift shop staff very friendly,helpful and welcoming. we were given a room in the furthest block from reception on the 4th floor. long corridors, abit gloomy and very quiet. would not have liked to have walked back to our room alone and would not have let my daughter. it felt a little bit eerie and too remote from the main part of the hotel. room was big and clean though and had a small balcony overlooking the car park! free shuttle bus to universal/citywalk and will drop off/pick up from metro too. on second day access key to complex and rooms would not work.after traipsing back to reception was told we were only booked in for one night. had to show them invoice to convince them it was two nights. finally gave us updated keys but no apology for inconvenience or attitude. hotel was quite a way out from centre of la which at first was a little disappointing but after going into the centre and seeing the amount of homeless and druggies was glad we were staying a little further out. would not return to la as second visit now and not too keen on it but if i had to ,would return to beverley hotel as long as i was with a couple of other people. decent enough hotel as long as there is a crowd of you. ask to stay in part of complex nearest reception.

Reviews.Title: “great all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snoglet
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in an excellent location for Universal (free shuttle) and within walking distance of the metro. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Had a King size bed in a very nice room with a balcony. Good restaurant on site. Very pleased all round, and would recommend to anybody. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ventalation problems”
Reviews.Author: moderate-traveller
Reviews.Content: The landscaping was nice, the people were nice, and the rates were totally reasonable. The restaurant and bar also had very reasonable rates. However, the building with rooms has serious mold and ventalation problems. I could barely breathe in the hallways and could only manage to survive in the room with a towel on the door crack and the sliding glass door wide open. The last night someone was smoking on a nearby balcony and that woke me up at 2am (they were quiet--it was just the smell). The first two nights I woke a few times from noise. I asked for a room on the side not facing the freeway, but the other road was super loud too. Both these problems wouldn't have occurred if I had simply closed my window--but, seriously, they have a problem with the air. You could see peeling paint and wallpaper in the bathrooms and in the vending room on each floor it was obvious. I'm not sure what the solution is--again, the layout of the grounds is very nice so it'd be a shame to raise the building but if it was my house I would.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to be in North Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: MooGooOne
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a five night stay at the BG Holiday Inn and thought it was comparable to a Marriott. This facility is self-contained; pool, restaurant, coffee shop, and bar all on the well-manicured premises. Great central location for touring Hollywood. Reasonable rates and friendly staff. Only downside was the[--] in the blond wig holding a mop who knocked on the door at 2 a.m. one night claiming to be "the Beverly Garland" and asking if we needed house cleaning service. Maybe this was just part of the Hollywood experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for seeing LA”
Reviews.Author: b10cjl
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Holiday Inn Universal Studios (formerly known as the Beverly Garland). Although it is a bit noisy due to proximity to Highway 101, it didn't stop us from sleeping and the proximity to 101 meant driving around was easy. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the pool area was great and the food in the restaurant was excellent. Altogether great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: NY_Trippy
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 5 night stay at Beverly's Hotel. If you must stay in North Hollywood and like a smaller hotel with excellent, friendly service, this is the place for you. The location is close to Universal Studios and shuttle service is available throughout the day. The hotel is literally 2 min. off the 101 Freeway. Stayed in the Portola building and enjoyed a large, spotless room on the 6th floor. The entire property is immaculate and the reception staff couldn't be more helpful. Several times, they printed out requested directions from their computer. The pool is easily accessible and is clean and quiet. Parking is $9/night - reasonable for the area. Tula's (restaurant) has a great $11.99 breakfast buffet, or you can order ala carte. Beverly's is a pleasant place to stay - and is one of the nicer Holiday Inn properties around.

Reviews.Title: “scary room”
Reviews.Author: xicana56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel after reading positive reviews on this site. Overall, the room was ok but it was scary because of the lock. It looked like someone had tried to break in as there was a deep break in the door where the security latch was. In addition, the door was loose and would move if you pushed against it even with the double locks in place. When I mentioned my concerns, I was offered an engineer but, because I felt that nothing short of a door replacement would help, I decided to wait it out as we were only there for another day. I liked the double sinks at the bathroom - this helped tremendously when we were getting dressed to go out. The dark hallways and block walls added to the scariness of this hotel. Not sure that I felt 100 percent safe and would probably not stay here again. Maid service was also inconsistent and minimal. By the way, I'm not a paranoid type person so it was unusual for me to be scared at this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Girl from giftshop/people from reception every day véry unfriendly!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi everybody! I just came back from a holiday trip to Los angeles. I was on my own. I went in total to three different hotels. My first hotel was awesome; people from the reception were incredibly friendly, wanted to help me with everything! My second hotel was Beverly Garland. TERRIBLE! Even the manager, i have never seen somebody doing so unfriendly to their guests. The girl from the giftshop, what was she thinking? She showed me that she didnt wanted to help me [she did this also to other guests] and IF she arranged something, she did everything wrong [few examples:] * she arranged a tour for me what wasnt available that day. I said that to her [!!] but she said it was confirmed and this was a exception. She refused to call the touroperator for me again. I went to that touroperator by myself [Starline tours] and I was right!! They said that the tour wasnt even available. I already paid for it, and it was all a waste of time. * I lost three very important irreplaceable things in my taxi. I asked them to help me, and i have waited literal 3 hours in the gift shop, she needed three hours to make a phone call to the taxi. And, believe it or not, after all that wasting of time [I wanted to see LA, not the gift shop~] she called the wrong taxi, while I said so many times to her which one it was. The reception promised me to call the right one. The day I was leaving, they still havent done it, i have explained my story literal 8 times. They were not interested at all. * My shower was broken. They promised to send someone, 5 hours later still nobody have went to my room. Location is quit isolated. Some people who have been there are describing it as "very quiet", well i am describing it as isolated. The aircondition is making a lot of noise. A nice thing is that every room has a little balcony and also a nice thing is that there is a restaurant next to the hotel with friendly people. I will not go to this hotel again. The one most important thing I noticed in Los angeles, was that everybody was so kind! Everyone is willing to help, everybody is greeting other people. So I was very surprised that the staff of this hotel was so rude. My other two hotels were awesome with very very kind people. So this is probably an exception.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but EXTREMELY NOISY!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have good news and bad news... First .. the good news... The staff at the Beverly Garland is very friendly and courteous. The pool temperature was very comfortable with plenty of towels and lounge chairs. The shuttle to Universal Studios was timely and convenient. The beds and pillows were comfortable, and the room was clean. I especially loved the overstuffed easy chair -- extremely comfortable! Now...the bad news..This was our 2nd stay at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn. We must have stay in a different area last time, because I don't remember the freeway noise being so LOUD. I kept checking the sliding door - thinking one of the kids might have opened it, but no, it is just so loud from the constant noise of freeway traffic. My husband went to the front desk around 11:30pm to request a quieter room. The person he spoke to said no 2-bed guestrooms were available, and said we were in one of the quieter room. Needless to say, we didn't sleep well. The rooms are not cheap, we paid (CSAA rate) 144.00 (plus sc) per night and $9.00+ for parking. We reserved a 2-night stay, however we actually checked out of the hotel before the 2nd night. (We only stayed one night instead of two). The women who finalized our bill was very nice, and she understood us wanting to check out early, and allowed us to do so without a penalty for cancelling our reservation. I just wanted to go home and get a 'good night sleep'. I figured driving 6-hours home was better than going 8-hours with that noise!!! Overall, the Beverly Garland is a decent place, the kids loved the pool, and the staff is very nice. I highly recommend asking for a room far away from the freeway. Would I stay there again? Only if I can be guaranteed a room facing furthest away from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Kidsuite was great!”
Reviews.Author: wubbuwu
Reviews.Content: On a road trip to Hollywood with my 14 & 12 year old kids (1 boy, 1 girl) we stayed at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn. The staff was very friendly (even returning my phone after I left it at the restaurant and wasn't able to come get it myself until the next morning). The kidsuite was great, though their selection of games & DVDs is extremely limited (glad we brought our own). It was great to have an empty fridge instead of a mini-bar fridge. Only hitch was not fitting on the Universal Studios shuttle the first day. I wasn't told seating was limited so didn't hurry to get in the front of the line. We didn't fit and I was told "no standing" and I'd have to wait for the next shuttle. But we needed to be at the park for our VIP tour time, so we had to pay for a cab. Then on the trip home, the same shuttle driver let 2 guests on without seats (standing).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: MrLittlewood
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn for a week in early June 2006 and we would thoroughly recommend the hotel. We stayed in the Eldorado building which was great. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean with a big bed, a big TV and a balcony. They are nicer than they look on the website. The Beverly Garland Holiday Inn is an excellent and safe location if you are staying or on holiday in Hollywood/LA. We hired a car and visited many places in and around LA. The hotel has a nice pool, a nice restaurant and a nice bar. All the staff are helpful, pleasant and friendly - especially the guy on reception and the girl in the shop. No sign of Beverly herself though. If you are visiting LA for the first time (UK people!)) it is best to hire a car. For us this was the first time driving in the USA and we didn't have any problems. The ability to go where we wanted in LA at any time made our holiday. Driving in LA is a shock at first however after about 30 minutes you will see how much easier it is than the UK. Parking at the hotel is $9 a day but there are plenty of spaces and it has very easy access to the motorway. Make sure you take or hire a SatNav though. It would have been a whole different story without it. The hotel is about a 20 minute drive from LAX but you might not be up to it after a 14 hours of flight time from the UK. There is an excellent Ralphs supermarket and mini shopping complex about a 3 minute walk for essentials and nibbles. A free shuttle bus takes you to and picks you up from Universal Studios/Universal City Walk several times a day.
